answers.answer: Can you please give a more detailed list of symptoms other than just numb and tingling?  More info would be extremely helpful.

Cant stand anything tight on my legs. Cold feeld hot hot feels cold.Cant sleep , bolt out of bed after 3-4 hours , tired as heck , but cant sleep. Cold weather seems to make the icy flushed feeling worse. I burn in my lips and face, up the back of my head , wobbly legged, .emotionally locked up, like a deer in the headlights , almost completely unfuntional....till 2 days after I started taking the 2 new meds. I can function in my job better now , and the "wierd" symptoms seem to be better.

Well, it sounds like you found the answer.  Thanks for posting this.  Have never heard of these symptoms before.  Very interesting.  Stress and depression can do horrid physical things to a person's body.
Hmmmmmmm............Well all I can say is I hope you find the right answer. I know mysterious problems are not fun to wonder about. Sorry I can't help, i am all messed up myself.Wish u the best.

I do have a nasty looking MRI of the cervical spine , and the posts I left on the neurology forum , well the replies say that  i have propable cause for the "stinging" & so forth in the cervical maladies. But I was thrown from a horse ( my passion) a couple of months before I broke down and went to the dr. I had read about "atlano-axial ligament tears" and wonered if this could be the cause. The chiropractor I went to had an xray that showed my atlas out of level to the right, he popped it back in and the symptoms seemed to go away. Maybe it was psycosomatic . but I sure do crunch a lot in my neck.This , I do belive, does not negate the fact that I'm bipolar. But can bipolar really cause numbness etc etc etc. ? If I knew for sure my neck wasnt gonna put me in a wheelchair, I'd ride again , . As I think about being thrown from my butt being 6-7' in the air flat on my back , would indicate my neck couldnt be that bad.

question: I have been posting on the neurology forum due to my symptoms of numbness & tingling all over my body . I do have an abnormal MRI. I have seen a surgeon and he says he can see where the numbness could affect my arms but not my whole body. I finally broke down and went to a Psychiatrist. I was diagnosed as "classic , textbook bipolar. I have taken zoloft for years now, but he changed me to Cymbalta & added depakote.My questions are;1) can the manic side , when under extreme stress, really cause such symptoms?2) if so, how long before the meds will take to diminish or completely alleviate these awful symptoms.As a side note , I have dealt with these symptoms off and on since I was 26, and no one can really understand where they come from . Everything from diabetes to MS has been ruled out.
title: confused & searching for answers
